document_data.caption: A map of the lands around Gray Oaks.
document_data.name: Gray Oaks
document_data.mainbody: '''Gray Oaks''' was a small village of [[halfling]] farmers in the [[Cormyr/Heartlands|heartlands]] of [[Cormyr]].
document_data.Description: Gray Oaks was a prosperous village and bustling agricultural center until it was destroyed and turned into a blasted ruin populated by stubborn holdouts. After its ruination it was a quiet place of simple means, with about 20 buildings and no fortifications.
document_data.Geography: Gray Oaks was situated in the [[Northbank (Cormyr)|Northbank]] region, north of the [[Starwater River]] and south of the [[King's Forest]], several miles west of [[Hilp]] and [[Calantar's Way]].
document_data.Trade:
Gray Oaks was formerly the largest market in Cormyr and the center of the halfling-dominated [[Northbank (Cormyr)|Northbank]] farmlands. After it was razed, [[Jester's Green]] became the main meeting place for farmers and caravans to meet, though several storage sheds were built for storing produce.

Gray Oaks had a reputation across Cormyr for having excellent wood craftsmen, and after it was razed it continued to be inhabited by stubborn halfling artisans. Several families of [[human]]s also made there home there, harvesting the [[mushroom]]s and [[moss]]es that grew on the rocks thereabouts. A particular kind of moss was found there that glowed, and it could be distilled into a useful substance used in making spell [[ink]]s and glowing magical items.
document_data.History:
Gray Oaks was once known as '''Black Oaks''', the "breadbasket of Northbank" and the largest farmer's market in Cormyr. It was mostly destroyed during the [[Time of Troubles]] in [[1358 DR]], and razed again later during some sort of magical battle involving [[War Wizards]] and an enemy force, the details of which were much exaggerated.

Although the village continued to be inhabited in the 1360s [[DR]], it was a shadow of its former self. It gradually recovered over time, reaching a population of 800 by [[1479 DR]]
document_data.Rumors & Legends:
* The nature of the battle that destroyed Gray Oaks for the second time was widely speculated about. War Wizards were a consistent feature, but different stories had them fighting against [[Zhentarim]] [[wizard]]s, [[Cyricist]] [[priest]]s, or the [[avatar]] of [[Cyric]] himself.
* Gray Oaks had a legend regarding the nearby [[Tearflow]] stream, involving a [[Purple Dragons|Purple Dragon]], a lady love, a crystal chalice, and a [[unicorn]].
document_data.Notable Locations:
* The [[Trailswatch]] inn, a base for hunters to go on guided hunts nearby.
* [[Sabrast Windriver]] owned an estate at Gray Oaks, among his other assets.{{Cite digital book/Elminster in Hell|?|14}}
